headline: Southern Company (SO): Examining Valuation After Analyst Downgrades and $1.75 Billion Capital Raise
summary: Southern (SO) is at the center of attention this week after its $1.75 billion composite units offering and a series of analyst rating downgrades. These developments combine financial strategy with shifting market sentiment, which is sparking investor interest in its valuation. See our latest analysis for Southern. Southern’s third-quarter earnings surprise and recent $1.75 billion capital raise stirred up activity, but momentum has faded in the last month. The share price dipped 7% despite a...

headline: Georgia Power, Salvation Army celebrate 40th anniversary of Project SHARE
summary: This month, Georgia Power, in collaboration with the Salvation Army, proudly celebrates the 40th anniversary of Project SHARE. Since its inception in 1985, the program has been a beacon of hope for over 425,000 families and more than 1.1 million individuals across Georgia, while continuing to support families in crisis. As one of the first fuel funds in America, Project Share has provided more than $84 million in essential assistance such as utilities, housing, food, and medical needs.

thumbnail.caption: To celebrate 40 years of partnership, Georgia Power and the Salvation Army have released two public service announcements.

headline: Cattle Look to New Monday Trade Following Last Week’s Losses
summary: Live cattle futures were up $2.50 to $3.05 on Friday to round out the week with $8.32 losses. Preliminary open interest was down 3,988 contracts. Last week’s cash trade was reported at $230-230.50 in the north, with $232 Southern sales last week. Feeder cattle futures rallied back higher into Friday’s...
